text:
[Hanuman kills Devanthaka and Trisira. Neela puts an end to Mahodara and Rshaba kills Mahaparsva.]

नरान्तकंहतंदृष्टवाचुक्रुशुर्नैरृतर्षभाः ।

देवान्तकस्त्रिमूर्धा च पौलस्त्यश्चमहोदरः ।।6.70.1।।
meaning: नरान्तकम् Naranthaka, हतम् killed, दृष्टवा seeing, नैरृतर्षभाः bull among Rakshasas, देवान्तकः Devanthaka, त्रिमूर्धा च Trisira, पौलस्त्यः of Paulastya, महोदरः च and Mahodara, चुक्रुशुः cried aloud.
translation: Seeing the bulls among Rakshasas Naranthaka, Devanthaka, Trisira and Mahodara a scion of Paulastya and Mahodara, killed the Rakshasas cried aloud.

meaning: महोदरः Mahodara, मेघसङ्काशम् resembling cloud, वारणेन्द्रम् best of elephants, आरूढः mounted, वीर्यवान् courageous, महावीर्यम् brave, वालिपुत्रम् Vali's son, अभिदुद्राव chased.
translation: Mahodara who closely resembled a cloud, mounted on the best of elephants chased brave and courageous son of Vali.

meaning: तदा then, भ्रातृव्यसनसन्तप्तः immersed in the grief of brother, बली powerful, देवान्तकः Devanthaka, दीप्तम् glowing, परिघम् iron bar, आदाय taking hold of, अङ्गदम् at Angada, समभिद्रवत् rushed forward.
translation: Then, powerful Devanthaka who was immersed in grief of his brother, taking hold of a glowing iron bar rushed forward towards Angada.

meaning: अथ and then, वीरः hero, त्रिशिराः Trisira, वाजिभिः best horse, युक्तम् yoked, आदित्यसङ्काशम् effulgent as the Sun, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय taking seat, वालिपुत्रम् Vali's son, अभ्ययात् marched.
translation: Then Trisira, seated on the chariot, effulgent as the Sun, yoked to the best horse marched towards Angada.

meaning: देवदर्पघ्नेः capable of crushing the pride of gods, त्रिभिः all the three, नैरृतेन्द्रः chiefs of Rakshasas अभिद्रुतः marching towards, सः he, अङ्गदः Angada, महाविटपम् huge, वृक्षम् tree, उत्पाटयामास uprooted.
translation: Angada observed that all the three chiefs of Rakshasas, who were capable of crushing the pride of gods marching towards him and uprooted a huge tree.

meaning: वीरः hero, अङ्गदः Angada, महाशाखम् huge branches, तम् those, महावृक्षम् huge tree, शक्रः branches, दीप्तम् flaming, अशनम् इव flaming thunderbolt, सहसा with force, देवान्तकाय Devanthaka, चिक्षेप hurled.
translation: Just as Indra took a flaming thunderbolt, Angada, the hero took hold of huge branches of trees and hurled at Devanthaka with force.

meaning: त्रिशिराः Trisira, आशीविषोपमैः venomous serpents, शरैः arrows, तम् them, प्रचिच्छेद split, तदा then, कृत्तम् action, वृक्षम् trees, आलोक्य observing, सःअङ्गदः that Angada, उत्पपात flew up.
translation: Trisira split the trees with the arrows which were like venomous serpents. Observing Angada's action he flew up.

meaning: ततः then, सः he, कपिकुञ्जरः leader of monkeys, वृक्षान् trees, शैलाश्च rocks also, ववर्षसङ्कृद्धः rained in anger, त्रिशिराः Trisira, निशितैः sharp, शरैः arrows, तान् himself, प्रचिच्छेद split.
translation: Then the leader of the monkeys, rained trees and rocks. Angry Trisira attacked all of them with sharp arrows.

meaning: महोदरः Mahodara, परिघाग्रेण with the iron clubs, तान् them, वृक्षान् trees, बभञ्ज shattered, त्रिशिराः Trisira, सायकैः arrows, वीरम् brave, अङ्गदम् Angada, अभिदुद्राव attacked.
translation: Mahodara shattered those trees with the iron clubs. Trisira attacked brave Angada with arrows.

meaning: महोदरः Mahodara, गजेन with elephant, वालिपुत्रम् Vali's son, समभिद्रुत्य chased towards, सङ्कृद्धः in anger, वज्रसन्निभैः which were like lightning, तोमरैः iron clubs, उरसि chest, जघान attacked.
translation: Mahodara chased the elephant on to Angada in anger and attacked him on his chest with his iron clubs.

meaning: तदा then, वेगवान् quickly, देवान्तकः च Devanthaka also, सङ्कृद्धः very furious, अङ्गदम् Angada, उपगम्य came over, आशु directly, परिघेण by the iron club, अभिहत्य attacked, व्यपचक्राम retreated.
translation: Then infuriated Devanthaka quickly came over Angada directly and attacked him with his iron club and retreated.

meaning: त्रिभिः three, नैरृतश्रेष्ठैः foremost of Rakshasas, युगपत् together, अभिद्रुतः attacked, महातेजाः highly energetic, प्रतापवान् eminent, सः he, वालिपुत्रः Vali's son, न विव्यथे not feel perturbed.
translation: Eminent and highly energetic son of Vali did not feel perturbed when three of the foremost Rakshasas attacked him together.

meaning: वेगवान् endowed with high speed दुर्जयः very difficult to encounter, सः he, महावेगम् quickly, कृत्वा done, भृशमुत्पत्य jumping up, अस्य their, महागजम् huge elephant, तलेन by the head, जघान attacked.
translation: Angada, who was endowed with high speed, and exceedingly difficult to encounter, jumped up the huge elephant of Mahodara attacked him.

meaning: तस्य its, तेन by that, प्रहारेण blow, संयुगे in battle, तस्यनागराजस्य that royal elephant, नयने eyes, रोचये dropped, सः the, वारणः elephant, विननाद cried.
translation: By that blow of Angada, that king of elephant's eyes dropped, and it cried.

meaning: महाबलः mighty, वालिपुत्रः Vali's son, संयुगे in battle, अस्य his, विषाणम् tusk, निष्कृष्य removed, देवान्तकम् Devanthaka, अभिद्रुत्य jumping over, ताडयामास hit him.
translation: Mighty son of Vali removed the tusk of the elephant and hit Devanthaka with it by jumping over him in the battlefield.

meaning: तेजस्वी astonishing, सः he, वातोद्धूतः thrown by the wind, द्रुमःइव like a tree, विह्वलः shaken, लाक्षारससवर्णम् colour of lacquer, महत् huge amount, रुधिरम् blood, सुस्राव shed.
translation: That astonishing Rakshasa shaken like a tree, thrown by the wind, shed huge amounts of blood which was of the colour of lacquer.

meaning: अथ and then, बली strong, महातेजाः terrible, देवान्तकः Devanthaka, कृच्छ्रात् iron spike, आश्वस्य on the horse, तदा then, वेगात् quickly, परिघम् iron club, आविध्य taking hold, अङ्गदम् Angada, आजघान pierced.
translation: Thereafter the terribly strong Devanthaka taking iron spike quickly pierced Angada.

meaning: तदा then, परिघाभिहतः hurt by iron bar, वानरेन्द्रात्मजः son of Vanara king, भूमौ ground, जानुभ्याम् on the knees, पतितः fallen, पुनरेव once again, उत्पपात ह got up.
translation: Then, hurt by the club the son of Vanara king fell down on his knees once again and got up.

meaning: त्रिशिराः Trisira, उत्पतन्तम् who got up, पुत्रम् son, तम् him, घोरैः terrible, अजह्मगैः straight going three, बाणैः arrows, ललाटे on forehead, अभिजघान ह again hit.
translation: While Angada was getting up, Trisira again hit him on the forehead with three straight going arrows.

meaning: ततः then, हनूमान् Hanuman, नीलश्चापि as well as Neela, त्रिभिः three, नैरृतपुङ्गवैः Rakshasa leaders, अङ्गदम् Angada, परिक्षिप्तम् surrounding, विज्ञाय knowing, अथ again, प्रतस्थतुः set out.
translation: Then finding Angada surrounded by the three Rakshasa leaders, Hanuman as well as Neela set out.

meaning: ततः there upon, नीलः Neela, तदा then, त्रिशिरसे on Trisira, शैलाग्रम् peak of mountain, चिक्षेप broken to pieces, धीमान् wise, रावणसुतः Ravana's son, निशितैः sharp, शरैः arrows, तत् then, बिभेद broke to pieces.
translation: Thereafter Neela hit Trisira with the peak of the mountain and Ravana's son broke the mountain into pieces with arrows.

meaning: बाणशतनिर्भिन्नम् broken by hundreds of arrows, तत् thereafter, गिरेःशिरः mountain peak, विदारितशिलातलम् peak of the mountain broken, सविस्फुलिङ्गम् sparks, सज्वालम् flames, निपपात fell.
translation: Hit by hundreds of arrows, the mountain peak broke into pieces of stones like sparks and flames fell from it.

meaning: बली mighty, सः he, देवान्तकः Devanthaka, आहवे in battle, हर्षात् happy, ततः then, जृम्भितम् , मारुतात्मजम् Hanuman, आलोक्य observing, परिघेण with his club, अभिदुद्राव assaulted.
translation: Mighty Devanthaka, observing (Trisira's action), was happy on the battlefield, and went with his club to assault Hanuman.

meaning: तदा then, मारुतात्मजः son of wind god, हनुमान् Hanuman, उत्पत्य got up, आपतन्तम् , तम् , वज्रकल्पेन which was like a thunderbolt, मुष्टिना with fist, मूर्ध्नि forehead, आजघान hit.
translation: Then the son of wind god, Hanuman observing Devanthaka coming towards him, got up and hit him on the forehead with his thunderbolt like fist.

meaning: तदा then, वीरः heroic, बली strong, वायुसुतः son of wind god, शिरसि on head, प्रहरत् blow, सः he, महाकपिः great monkey, नादेन sound, राक्षसान् Rakshasas, अकम्पयच्चैव trembled.
translation: When the heroic and strong son of the wind god hit on the head of Devanthaka, the Rakshasas trembled by the sound of the great monkey 's blow.

meaning: मुष्टिनिष्पिष्टविभिन्नमूर्धा skull shattered by the blow, निर्वान्तदन्ताक्षिविलम्बिजिव्वाः teeth, eyes and tongue forced out, राक्षसराजसूनुः son of king of Rakshasas, सः he, देवान्तकः Devanthaka, गतासुः dead, सहसा instantly, उर्व्याम् on ground, पपात fell.
translation: Devanthaka's skull was shattered by the blow, and his teeth, eyes and tongue were forced out, the son of Rakshasa king fell dead on the ground.

meaning: राक्षसयोधमुख्ये foremost of Rakshasa warriors, देवशत्रौ enemy of gods, महाबले endowed with great strength, तस्मिन् their, संयति in conflict, हते killed, क्रुद्धः angry, त्रिमूर्धा one with three heads, नीलोरसि over Neela, उग्रम् top, बाणवर्षम् rained arrows, ववर्ष rained.
translation: Devanthaka, the foremost of Rakshasa warriors, an enemy of gods, endowed with great strength, having been killed in the conflict, Trisira became angry and rained arrows on Neela's chest.

meaning: सः he, महोदरस्तु at Mahodara, सङ्कृद्धः enraged, रमशिमान् Sun god, मन्दरम् इव springing on Mandara, पर्वतोपमम् over the mountain, कुञ्जरम् elephant, भूयः becoming, समधिरुह्य mounted, आशु quickly, ततः then, नीलस्य Neela's, उपरि chest, तोयदः water, तडिच्चक्रचापवानि rainy cloud with lightning and rainbow, वर्षम् wetted, गिरौइव on the mountain like, बाणमयम् covered with arrows, वर्षम् rain, अपातयत् showered.
translation: Mahodara got enraged, mounted on an elephant just as the Sun went over Mandara mountain and went for war. Then Mahodara wielding bow rained arrows, just as rainy clouds with lightning and rainbows showers rain, on the mountain like chest of Neela.

meaning: सः he, महोदरस्तु at Mahodara, सङ्कृद्धः enraged, रमशिमान् Sun god, मन्दरम् इव springing on Mandara, पर्वतोपमम् over the mountain, कुञ्जरम् elephant, भूयः becoming, समधिरुह्य mounted, आशु quickly, ततः then, नीलस्य Neela's, उपरि chest, तोयदः water, तडिच्चक्रचापवानि rainy cloud with lightning and rainbow, वर्षम् wetted, गिरौइव on the mountain like, बाणमयम् covered with arrows, वर्षम् rain, अपातयत् showered.
translation: Mahodara got enraged, mounted on an elephant just as the Sun went over Mandara mountain and went for war. Then Mahodara wielding bow rained arrows, just as rainy clouds with lightning and rainbows showers rain, on the mountain like chest of Neela.

meaning: ततः then, शरौघैः wetted by arrows, अभिवृष्यमाणः fully all over, कपिसैन्यपालः monkey leader, नीलः Neela, विभिननगात्रः all limbs pierced, बभूव remained, अथ and then, विसृष्टगात्रः limbs sunken, महाबलेन endowed with extraordinary strength, तेन by that, विष्टम्भितः could not move.
translation: Neela's body wetted by arrows all over, the limbs pierced with arrows, the monkey leader remained powerless and could not move in spite of being extraordinarily strong.

meaning: ततः thereafter, नीलःतु Neela also, प्रतिलभ्यसंज्ञाम् regaining senses, सवृक्षषंण्डम् filled with trees, शैलम् mountain, समुत्पाट्य uprooting, ततः then, भृशोग्रवेशः at high speed, समुत्पत्य reaching over, तेन by that, महोदरम् Mahodara, मूर्ध्नि forehead, जघान attacked.
translation: Thereafter Neela also regained his senses and uprooting a mountain filled with trees went over Mahodara at high speed and attacked him on the forehead.

meaning: ततः then, शैलेद्रनिपातभग्नः smashed by the impact of the mountain, सःमहोदरः that Mahodara, तेन by that, महाद्विपेन along with elephant, विपोथितः fell, गतासुः released of life, वज्राभिहतः hit by lightning, अद्रिःयथा like a mountain, भूमितले on ground, पपात fell.
translation: Then smashed by the impact of the mountain, along with his elephant Mahodara's body fell to the ground. Released from life, he fell like a mountain struck with lightning.

meaning: त्रिशिराः Trisira, पितृव्यम् uncle, निहतम् killed, दृष्टवा seeing, सङ्कृद्धः very angry, चापम् bow, आददे seized, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, निशितैः sharp, शरैः arrow, विव्याथ pierced.
translation: Trisira got enraged seeing his uncle killed, seized his bow and with a sharp arrow pierced Hanuman.

meaning: सः he, वायुसूनुः son of wind god, कुपितः in anger, गिरेः mountain, शिखरम् top, चिक्षेप hurled, बली mighty, त्रिशिराः Trisira, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, शरैः arrow, बहूधा several pieces, बिभेद split into.
translation: The son of the wind god in anger hurled a top of the mountain on mighty Trisira, who split the mountain into several pieces with an arrow.

meaning: तदा then, कपिः monkey, तत् that, शिखरम् top of mountain, व्यर्थम् ineffective, दृष्टवा seeing, तस्मिन् over him, रणे battle, रावणस्य Ravana's, सुतंप्रति over the son, द्रुमवर्षम् rain of trees, विससज्ज discharged.
translation: Then seeing that the top of the mountain hurled was ineffective in that battle over Ravana's son, Hanuman discharged rain of trees.

meaning: प्रतापवान् stupendous, त्रिशिराः Trisira, आ पतन्तम् tore, तम् them, द्रुमवर्षम् rain of trees, निशितैः whetted, बाणैः rain, आकाशे the sky, चिच्छेद shattered, ननादच roared.
translation: Stupendous Trisira tore with his whetted arrows the rain of trees through the sky and roared.

meaning: तदा then, हनुमान् तु Hanuman also, क्रुद्धः angry, उत्प्लुत्य jumping up, त्रिशिरसः at Trisira, हयम् horse, मृगराट् lion, नागेन्द्रम् इव like lordly elephant, नखैः nails, विददार tore.
translation: Then Hanuman also jumped up in anger and tore the horse off Trisira just as the lion would tear the lordly elephant with nails.

meaning: तथ in the same way, रावणात्मजः Ravana's son, त्रिशिराः Trisira, अन्तकः Death, काळरात्रिम् इव like Kalaratri (Kaala, the deity presiding over the night of dissolution) शक्तिम् javelin, समादाय seizing, अनिलपुत्राय at the son of wind god, चिक्षेप shattered.
translation: In the same manner, Trisira, the son of Ravana sprung up and seized a javelin, just as God of death in dark night and hurled at the son of wind god and shattered.

meaning: हरिश्रेष्ठः best of the monkeys, दिवः heaven, क्षिप्ताम् flung, उल्कामिव like a meteor, तांशक्तिम् that javelin, असङ्गताम् obstructed, गृहीत्वा taking, बभञ्ज च snapped, ननाद च and roared.
translation: Hanuman, the best of monkeys, snapped the javelin flung by Trisira on him, which came down unobstructed like a meteor from heaven and the monkeys roared.

meaning: घोरसङ्काशाम् dreadful form, तांशक्तिम् of that javelin, हनूमता by Hanuman, भग्नाम् shattered, दृष्टवा seeing, प्रहृष्टाःवानरगणाः all Vanaras rejoiced, जलदाःइव like the rain clouds, विनेदुः thundered.
translation: Seeing the dreadful form of shattered javelin, all Vanaras rejoiced and thundered like rain clouds.

meaning: राक्षसोत्तमः foremost of Rakshasas, त्रिशिराः Trisira, ततः that, व्यूढं placed, समुद्यम्य lifting up, तदा then, खडगम् sword, वायुपुत्रस्य into son of wind god, वक्षसि chest of, निजघा dug into.
translation: Trisira, the foremost of Rakshasas then lifted his sword, placed it on the chest of Hanuman and dug into it.

meaning: खडगप्रहाराभिहतः hit by sword, वीर्यवान् hero, मारुतात्मजः wind god's son, हनुमान् Hanuman, तलेन palm, तिशिरसम् Trisira, उरसि chest, आजघान attacked.
translation: Heroic Hanuman hit by Trisira, attacked him with his palm on the chest.

meaning: महातेजाः highly energetic, सःत्रिशिराः that Trisira, तेन by that, तलाभिहतः hit by palm, स्रस्तहस्तायुधः weapon dropped from hand, त्यक्तचेतनः senses lost, भुवि ground, निपपात fell.
translation: Trisira, a highly energetic one, hit by Hanuman with his palm, dropped the weapon from his hand, lost his senses and fell on the ground.

meaning: रिसङ्काशः who resembled mountain, सः he, महाकपिः great Vanara, पततः falling down, तस्य his, तंखङ्गम् that sword, अच्छिद्य taking, सर्वनारृता all those surrounded, त्रासयन् creating terror, ननाद roared.
translation: Taking the sword from Trisira, as he was falling, the great Vanara who resembled a mountain roared, creating terror in all, surrounded there.

meaning: निशाचरः Rakshasa, तंघोषम् that roar, अमृष्यमाणः unable to bear, उत्पपात got up, उत्पत्य jumping, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, मुष्टिना fist, ताडयामास struck.
translation: Unable to bear that roar, that Rakshasa got up jumping and struck Hanuman with his fist.

meaning: महाकपिः great monkey, तेन by that, मुष्टिप्रहारेण by the hit with fist, सञ्चुकोप became furious, कुपितः च and angry, राक्षसर्षभम् bull among Rakshasas, किरीटे crown, निजग्राह got hold of.
translation: The great monkey hit by the fist (of Trisira) became furious and in anger he got hold of Trisira's head with crown.

meaning: क्रुद्धः enraged, सः he, अनिलस्यसुतः wind god's son, तस्य his, कीरीटजुष्टानि along with crown, सकुण्डलानि and earrings, शीर्षाणि three heads (of Vishwarupa), शक्रः Indra, त्वष्टुः Twashsta's, सुतस्य son's, शिरांसिइव three heads like that, शितेन sharp, असिना cut off, प्रचिच्छेद severed.
translation: Enraged wind god's son, cut off the three heads of Trisira adorned with earrings just as Indra cut off the heads of Vishwarupa, son of Twashta.

meaning: आयताक्षाणि incongruous eyes, अगसन्निभानि resembling mountains, प्रदीप्तवैश्वानरलोचनानि glowing like Vyshvanara's eyes, इन्द्ररिपोः Indra's enemy, तानिशिरांसि those heads, अर्कमार्गात् from the path of the Sun, मुक्तानि like pearls, ज्योतींषियथा like stars, अरण्याम् wilderness, पेतुः fallen.
translation: The heads of Trisira, an enemy of Indra, resembling mountains with incongruous eyes glowing like Vyshvanara's eyes, fell into wilderness like stars fallen from the path of Sun.

meaning: देवरिपौ enemy of gods, तस्मिन् his, त्रिशीर्षे Trisira's, शक्रपराक्रमेण endowed with the prowess of Indra, हनूमता Hanuman, हते killed, प्लवंगाः monkeys, नेदुः roared, भूमिः earth, प्रचचाल shook, अथो and, रक्षांसि Rakshasas, समन्तात् in all sides, दुद्रुविरे took to their heels.
translation: Trisira, the enemy of gods, endowed with the prowess of Indra got killed by Hanuman. The earth shook, the monkeys roared and the Rakshasas from all sides took to their heels.

meaning: त्रिशिरसं Trisira, हतम् killed, दृष्टवा witnessing, अथापि च earlier, महोदरम् Mahodara, दुराधर्षौ difficult to encounter, देवान्तकनरान्तकौ Devanthaka and Naranthaka, हतौ killed, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, परमामर्षी roared in joy, राक्षसपुङ्गवः Rakshasa leaders, मत्तः Matta, चुकोप very angry.
translation: Witnessing Trisira killed, earlier Mahodara also, Devanthaka and Naranthaka who are difficult to encounter killed, monkeys roared in joy seeing that Matta became very angry.

meaning: शुभाम् good, अर्चिष्मतीम् venerable, सर्वायसीम् all powerful, हेमपरिक्षिप्ताम् plated with gold, मांसशोणितफेनिलाम् smeared with flesh and blood, विराजमानाम् shining with lustre, वपुषाम् by enemy's, शत्रुशोणितरंजिताम् shining in red colour with enemy's blood, तेजसा effulgent, संप्रदीप्ताग्राम् whose head has been glowing, रक्तमाल्यविभूषिताम् decorated with red flower garland s, ऐरावतमहापद्मसार्वभौमभयावहाम् brought terror to Airavata, Mahapadma and Sarvabhauma (three of the four elephants guarding the quarters), गदाम् mace, जग्राह seized hold of.
translation: Mahaparsva seized hold of a good venerable, allpowerful mace plated with gold, smeared with flesh and blood, shining with lustre, shining red with enemy's blood, an effulgent one whose head has been glowing decorated with red flower garlands that brought terror to Airavatam, Mahapadma, and Sarvabhuama, the three elephants guarding the three of the four quarters.

meaning: शुभाम् good, अर्चिष्मतीम् venerable, सर्वायसीम् all powerful, हेमपरिक्षिप्ताम् plated with gold, मांसशोणितफेनिलाम् smeared with flesh and blood, विराजमानाम् shining with lustre, वपुषाम् by enemy's, शत्रुशोणितरंजिताम् shining in red colour with enemy's blood, तेजसा effulgent, संप्रदीप्ताग्राम् whose head has been glowing, रक्तमाल्यविभूषिताम् decorated with red flower garland s, ऐरावतमहापद्मसार्वभौमभयावहाम् brought terror to Airavata, Mahapadma and Sarvabhauma (three of the four elephants guarding the quarters), गदाम् mace, जग्राह seized hold of.
translation: Mahaparsva seized hold of a good venerable, allpowerful mace plated with gold, smeared with flesh and blood, shining with lustre, shining red with enemy's blood, an effulgent one whose head has been glowing decorated with red flower garlands that brought terror to Airavatam, Mahapadma, and Sarvabhuama, the three elephants guarding the three of the four quarters.

meaning: शुभाम् good, अर्चिष्मतीम् venerable, सर्वायसीम् all powerful, हेमपरिक्षिप्ताम् plated with gold, मांसशोणितफेनिलाम् smeared with flesh and blood, विराजमानाम् shining with lustre, वपुषाम् by enemy's, शत्रुशोणितरंजिताम् shining in red colour with enemy's blood, तेजसा effulgent, संप्रदीप्ताग्राम् whose head has been glowing, रक्तमाल्यविभूषिताम् decorated with red flower garland s, ऐरावतमहापद्मसार्वभौमभयावहाम् brought terror to Airavata, Mahapadma and Sarvabhauma (three of the four elephants guarding the quarters), गदाम् mace, जग्राह seized hold of.
translation: Mahaparsva seized hold of a good venerable, allpowerful mace plated with gold, smeared with flesh and blood, shining with lustre, shining red with enemy's blood, an effulgent one whose head has been glowing decorated with red flower garlands that brought terror to Airavatam, Mahapadma, and Sarvabhuama, the three elephants guarding the three of the four quarters.

meaning: सङ्कृद्धः very furious, राक्षसपुङ्गवः Rakshasa leader, मत्तः Matta, गदाम् mace, आदाय taking, ज्वलन् fire, युगान्तानगिरिव like at the time of the end of universe, हरीन् monkeys, समभिदुद्राव scattered.
translation: Matta, the Rakshasa leader became very furious and took hold of the mace glowing like fire, at the time of dissolution of the universe and scattered the monkeys.

meaning: अथ and then, बली endowed with prowess, र्षभः bull, वानरः among Vanaras, उत्पत्य springing up, रावणानुजम् Ravana's brother, मत्तानीकम् Mahaparsva (Mattaneekam), उपागम्य coming near, तस्य his, अग्रतः anger, तस्थौ his, तस्याग्रतो stood in his front.
translation: Rshaba, the bull among Vanaras endowed with prowess, springing up came and stood in front of Mahaparsva.

meaning: पुरस्तात् again, स्थितम् standing, पर्वतोपमम् like a mountain, वानरम् Vanara, दृष्टवा seeing, क्रुद्धः angry, वज्रकल्पया close to thunderbolt, गदया with mace, उरसि on the chest, आजघान hit.
translation: Again, seeing Rshaba standing in front like a mountain, enraged Mahaparsva hit him on the chest with the mace that was like a thunderbolt.

meaning: तेन by that, तया by the, गदया mace, अभिहतः hit that way, सः he, वानरर्षभः bull of Vanaras, भिन्नवक्षाः chest broken, समाधूतः moved, बहु excessively, रुधिरम् blood, सुस्राव flowed.
translation: Hit in that way by the mace, Rshaba, bull of Vanaras, with chest broken, blood flowed excessively.

meaning: वानरेश्वरा Vanara chief, सःऋषभः that Rshaba, चिरात् after long time संज्ञाम् consciousness, प्राप्य regained, क्रुद्धः angered, विस्फुरमाणौष्ठः lips quivering, महापार्श्वम् to Mahaparsva, उदैक्षत ran.
translation: Regaining consciousness after a long time the monkey chief, Rshaba, was angry, his lips quivering as he was, ran to Mahaparsva.

meaning: वेगवान् endowed with speed, शैलनिकाशरूपः of mountain like form, सः he, वानरवीरमुख्यः chief of Vanaras, वेगवत् quickly, अभ्युपेत्य getting up, मुष्टिम् fist, सम्वर्त्य duly, तंराक्षसम् that Rakshasa, बाह्वन्तरे space between two arms, सहसा forcibly, जघान hit.
translation: The chief of the Vanaras, whose form was like a mountain, endowed with speed, got up quickly, duly, and forcibly hit the Rakshasa (Mahaparsva) in the space between his arms.

meaning: सः he, कृत्तमूलः roots severed, वृक्षःइव like the tree, क्षतजोक्षिताङ्गः all his limbs smashed, सहसा forcibly, क्षितौ broken, पपात fell, तदा then, अस्य his, घोराम् dreadful, यमदण्डकल्पाम् which was like Lord of death 's rod, तांगदाम् that mace, आशु hold, प्रगृह्य seizing, ननाद roared.
translation: Like a tree whose roots have been severed, the Rakshasa fell on the ground. Then seizing forcibly, the dreadful mace that resembled the rod of Lord of death he roared.

meaning: सः he, मुहूर्तम् for a short while, गतासुकल्पः life gone like, आसीत् seated, सहसा suddenly, सन्ध्याभ्रसमानवर्णः of the colour of evening sun, सुरारिः enemy of gods, प्रत्यागतात्मा life having restored, उत्पत्य got up, तम् him, वारिराजात्मजम् son of waters, आजघान struck.
translation: For a short while, Mahaparsva, the enemy of gods remained as if life had gone off up and struck the son of waters (Rshaba).

meaning: सः he, मूर्भितः unconscious, मुहूर्तम् for a while, भूमितले on the ground, पपात fallen, ससंज्ञः regained, पुनः again, उत्पत्य got up, तस्य his, अद्रिवराद्रिकल्पाम् which looked like rock of a foremost mountain, ताम् him, गदामेव with mace, समाविध्य overcoming, सङ्ख्ये battlefield, जघान struck.
translation: The monkey was unconscious for a while having fallen on the ground. Regaining senses, overcoming, took up the mace which looked like the rock of a foremost mountain and struck him (Mahaparsva) on the battlefield.

meaning: रौद्रा ferocious, सा he, रौद्रस्य in anger, देवाध्वरविप्रशत्रोः enemy of gods and brahmins, तस्य his, देहम् body, समुपेत्य reaching near, वक्षः chest, बिभेद split, अद्रिराजः Himalaya mountain, धात्वम्भः water, भूरि timid, क्षतजम् with minerals, सुस्राव flowed.
translation: He (Rshaba) reached the body of the ferocious enemy of gods and brahmins. He split his chest with his mace and the timid Rakshasa shed blood just as Himalaya Mountain discharges water.

meaning: महात्मा great, सः he, महात्मनः great soul, तस्य his, गदाम् mace, अभिदुद्राव went towards, भीमाम् dreadful, तांगदाम् that mace, गृहीत्वा taking hold, पुनःपुनः again and again, आविध्य pierced, रणमूर्धनि in the forefront of the battle, मत्तानीकम् Mattanikam, जघान struck.
translation: The great Rakshasa Mahaparsva went towards the mace held by Rshaba, the great soul. Taking hold of the mace, Rshaba struck the Rakshasa again and again and pierced him in the forefront of the battlefield.

meaning: स्वया his own, गदया mace, भग्नः shattered by, सः he, मत्तः Matta विशीर्णदशनेक्षणः whose eyes had been crushed, तदा then, वज्राहतः struck by lightning, अचलःइव like a mountain, निपपात fallen.
translation: Shattered by his own mace, Matta (Mahaparsva), whose eyes had been crushed, had fallen like a mountain struck by lightning.

meaning: गतसत्त्वे strength gone, गतायुषि life ceased, विदीर्णनयने eyes crushed, तस्मिन् राक्षसे his Rakshasas, भूमौ ground, पतिते fallen, राक्षसम् Rakshasa, बलम् army, विद्रुतम् ran in fear.
translation: Strength gone, life ceased, eyes crushed, his own Rakshasas fallen on the ground, the Rakshasa army fled.
